meanings.definition: An ancestor in the direct line.
meanings.sent1: My primogenitors came from a long line of farmers.
meanings.sent2: The primogenitors of our family settled in this town generations ago.
meanings.sent3: It's fascinating to learn about our primogenitors and their lives.
meanings.sent4: The primogenitors of modern technology paved the way for innovation.
meanings.sent5: The stories of our primogenitors are passed down through the ages.

meanings.sent1: Our primogenitors were known for their wisdom and strength.
meanings.sent2: The primogenitors of this ancient civilization are revered.
meanings.sent3: I wonder what our primogenitors would think of our modern world.
meanings.sent4: The primogenitors of this family tree laid a strong foundation.
meanings.sent5: We owe our existence to our primogenitors.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that serves as a model or precursor for later developments.
meanings.sent1: The primogenitors of democracy influenced many nations.
meanings.sent2: In art history, the primogenitors of realism are well studied.
meanings.sent3: Even in fashion, our primogenitors' style is making a comeback.
meanings.sent4: The primogenitors of this genre of music inspired countless artists.
meanings.sent5: Studying the primogenitors of science helps us understand progress.
